author: Mehboob Jeelani
text:
Congress vice-president Rahul Gandhi will hit the Mumbai streets on Saturday for a protest against the “increasing” electricity tariff and the suspension of the Street Vendors Act, a policy implemented by the previous United Progressive Alliance government. Mr. Gandhi will take out a “padayatra” from Bandra to Dharavi.

“He will meet people who are struggling to pay their electricity bills,” Mumbai Congress chief Sanjay Nirupam told The Hindu .

Accusing the Shiv Sena-BJP government of “deliberately” forestalling the Street Vendors Act, Mr. Nirupam said Mr. Gandhi would tell hawkers how beneficial the policy would be if the government implemented it “correctly”.

After arriving in Mumbai on Friday, Mr. Gandhi will first hold a marathon meeting with Mumbai-based Congress workers and then meet various delegations of taxi drivers, auto-rickshaw drivers and fishermen communities.

“The old Kaali-Peeli taxi drivers will tell Mr.Gandhi how their business has suffered with the arrival of Uber and Ola,” Mr.Nirupam said. “They certainly expect some solution from the government.” On the same day, Mr.Gandhi will also deliver a lecture to students at Narsee Monjee College of Commerce and Economics.
title: Rahul to lead protest march
